conclusion: To determine the heat transferred, analyze the process from state A to B and B to C using the first law of thermodynamics.
The first law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
Internal energy of an ideal gas depends only on temperature. If temperature is constant, ΔU = 0, so Q = W.
Work done by the system for volume change: W = P ΔV.
Since ΔV = 0 from A to B, W_AB = 0 J.
Calculate ΔV from B to C: ΔV = V_C - V_B = -4.0 x 10^-3 m^3.
Calculate W_BC: W_BC = (P_B + P_C)/2 x ΔV = -1.0 x 10^3 J.
Total work done W_total = W_AB + W_BC = -1.0 x 10^3 J.
Since ΔU = 0, Q = W_total = -1.0 x 10^3 J.
The heat transferred by the gas is -1000 J.
